content: PLEASE MAKE A SEQUEL! Just a pleasure to play! Fantastic story, the quests were relevant and did not feel like fluff, there are plenty of secrets and hidden loot to find, satisfyingly RPG leveling system, dialogue is pretty good and characters have personality. Oh, the exploration and combat make it immersive and really fun! My only complaint is that the game is short. I was DEEP into it, then in only a few hours it was over. TOTALLY worth the price for the paid version, but I WANT MORE
It's really awesome
TOO SHORT
Easy to get into and play and good in short bursts or from start to finish as it is not a long game, perfect game for mobile, hope for a sequel.
I liked the game a lot then they wanted me to buy it again, nope.
It was super fun! Love the futuristic feel of it.
Whatever I think doesn't matter. Give it a shot and you'll give it five stars as well.
paid ads

Good game, but riddled with the worst UI I have seen in the hundreds of Android games I have played, and 38 years of gaming experience on PC and predecessors. It is old though, from 2010. Game mechanics themselves are pretty simple, but even at the end of the 6 hours it took me to finish it, I still had trouble remembering how to get to certain things. It's just so completely counter-intuitive to me. It's also very easy, so after you get geared up, you can just steamroll through the later half.
still one my favorites, even many years after

Played well for 5 or 10 minutes, then crashed the phone. Forced reboot that presented a 'Retry or Factory Data Reset' option on trying to boot. (Had never happened prior to playing this game.) From the brief play of it, the game looked good. Acceptable graphics, solid storyline, good mechanics. Playing on a low-end phone, which may be the issue.
I paid money for this and they started showing ads. Not cool.
Got the game when it first came out, good to see it is still updated.

This is a very old game now, it came out in 2011 on Symbian. It's a top 
down action RPG with a fairly cool cyberpunk story. The gameplay isn't 
fantastic, the combat is really simple and parts of the interface are 
fiddly, but it's okay. If you like Neuromancer and Snow Crash and System 
Shock then give it a try.
The game reminds me of Shadowrun, which I used to love playing as a kid, and for $2, great buy for the price.
One of the first games I bought and played on mobile, some 6 or 7 years ago. Still one of the best games on mobile, highly recommended :)

THE GOOD: well-done old-school graphics and music. Decent conttols. Runs smoothly. Is cyberpunk. THE BAD:  almost entirely linear story, with a full set of cliches. Almost entirely linear dungeons. The only tactics needed most of the time were focus fire and waiting for wandering enemies to separate.  Difficulty doesn't incrrase much in the late game (genre appropriate, maybe). THE VERDICT: didn't hate it, eould be interested in a sequel.

This game is definitely cool. However, it is almost unplayable on my Note 4. This game doesn't scale to the resolution so the higher res your phone, the more there is on your screen. The problem with this is that it makes the game run really slow. It also makes it very hard to try and control the game, because everything you tap on is super small. There's no zoom option for this. Hopefully the devs can find a solution to this as otherwise the game is quite fun. I just can't play it in its current state.

This looks like a fun game but on my LG G2 the game isnt responding to taps on the right side of the screen. If i pan so that what im tapping is on the left side then it works fine. This is the only app that I've had this problem with.

PROS: +Fun. +Decent story, of a cyber-punk mold. +Great atmosphere. +Pretty good character customization. +Non-linear dungeon crawling. +Modest hardware and OS (Android 1.6) requirements. +Takes up very little data space (only 13MB).  CONS: -Story is a bit clich√©. -No online leaderboards to reflect progression.

Cyberlords Arcology is very fun little game that is well worth the price. The main story is linear but there are a few side quests to be found. Don't let the shortish plot get you down though. Customizing your team is where the real fun is found. With weapons armor and cybernetics, your characters will have more than a few options to test out. I find a team of two melee fighters and two shooters seems to get me through most fights. The best part is the game has no IAPs or permissions. I'd like a sequel.
My favorite Android game
But it'll do until then.

A well-styled Cyberpunk game., but with a few flaws but room for expanded gameplay or a sequel.   Some elements of the GUI could use more feedback, such as a sound or indicators. Combat is awkward with limited controls.  It would be nice to get more interaction and choices, perhaps building your character from the ground up in style, but for what the game is, it's definitely better than its cyberpunk game peers on android.  The game is worthy of expanding or developing further. Looking forward to more.
Very fun but pretty short
Cool
No ads, no IAP, no permissions, no bugs. Game itself is thoroughly enjoyable and will keep you entertained for a few good hours.
I loved this game, however due to it being waaaay too short I can't rate it a five. Waiting for a sequel!

Some people want to see the battle flow while being able to attack at the same time, it's 2014 and to my understanding this games been updated tons of times, yet this simple yet massively underrated feature is nowhere to be seen, -1 üåü just for that. Too short and linear as well.

Man I just finished up Baldur's Gate and I am waiting on BG2EE to be realeased. I may play through BG1 one more time and if BG2EE still isn't out I will put more time into Cyberlords. Either way Cyberlords is on my list of games to finish. Imagine Baldur's Gate set in the future released on Sega Genesis. That is the feeling I have from this game. The gameplay is just like Baldur's but in the future. I love this retro feel to the game but at the same time I think it would be cool for any sequels to offer a bit more graphically. The game does has it's flaws but they are minor (at least the ones I have come across) and none of them so far seem to be game breakers. I have only put about an hour into this game so far and so far the only main complaint I have (which may be resolved when I am farther in the game) is the quests seem to be short. So far I get a quest move maybe one map over and bam there is the solution. Every game of this type though sort of walks you through at the beginning so I have hope that this will change farther down the line. When I have put more time into this game I will come back and adjust my review as neccassary if I feel it even is.
This is a must have for all shadowrun or fallout 2 fans.

Brilliant throwback to RPGs of yore.  Very reminiscient of Shadowrun on the SNES... in fact I think the music is even the same.   We need more games like this on googleplay.  The only gripe is that it is too short, even on hard.   Tyvm for making this.

Cyberloads Arcology provides a nice presentation of a strictly linear cyberpunk story revolving around 4 heroes who take it upon themselves to take on The Man. The controls can be a bit klunky (e.g. accessing the equipment menu and the map), but most of the gameplay is fluid and intuitive. The lack of a minimap and/or map zooming is a minor nuisance, but not enough to be problematic. Unlike so many "real-time" games, this one has a toggle for "tactical mode," which is basically "pause and give commands," so the player has a great deal of control over how fast combat resolves. If you enjoy 1980's/90's-style top-down adventure games, this one is sure to please. Currently 2 hours into it and haven't seen any crashes or significant bugs.
